channel.title: Research on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Libraries
channel.description: Recent content in Research on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Libraries

item.title: Enabling discovery and reuse of your GIS research
item.description: The Harvard Map Collection collects and preserves GIS data for long-term discovery and reuse in the Harvard Geospatial Library (HGL) . You might like to extend the long-term value of your research by making your data available in a tool like HGL or Dataverse , or perhaps you’d like some feedback on how you are communicating the GIS components of your project. Maybe this is the first time you are thinking about this topic, and it sounds intriguing to you.

item.title: Documentation 101
item.description: This guide can be used on your own or together with a librarian during a guided interview . Documentation elements Originator(s) The name(s) of the organization(s) or individual(s) who developed the dataset. Publication Date The date when the dataset is published or otherwise made available for release. Calendar Date(s) of the Content The date, dates or date range describing the content of the dataset. Title A title for the dataset.
